title: David McKee Gallery light Gill Sans-like face
content:
Anyone? it's similar to gill sans but not an exact match.  
TIA

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072242im_/http:/typophile.com/files/mckee-gallery_4045.jpg)
author: slokai

comments.content:
Looks like Gill Schoolbook/Gill Infant but I can't find a light weight online.

- Lex

Well thats what i thought it was and still do but I think the M is different so I cant be sure here's a link! [Gill Sans](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072242/http:/www.fonts.com/findfonts/_tryfont.htm?Pid=427675&ProductNo=OPS616393&ProductID=162151&SiteID=ODBV&SourceFoundry=Monotype%20Imaging&productname=Gill%20Sans%C2%AE%20Complete%20Family%20Pack)
Thats a light there Lex, what do you think about the m?

The 'M' was probably taken from Futura. The rest looks like Gill Schoolbook.

- Lex

Don’t mean to hijack but... What are INFANT types???

Monotype has several “Infant” branded families.

Mikey :0)

"The ’M’ was probably taken from Futura. The rest looks like Gill Schoolbook"

Not sure of a few other characters either, the 'a' for instance. Isn't it two-storeyed in Gill Sans? The numeral '1' also looks wrong.

(Edit: Just managed to find a sample of Gill Sans Schoolbook. The 'a' and '1' are indeed correct. Posted too soon, apologies)

-  
Arun  
-

Where did you find a light version of Gill Sans Schoolbook, Arun?

Sharon

There were one-storey a's and Futura like "M's in Gill Sans, special lead cuts usually used in northern Europe. But the "R" doesn't look like Gill.

See also:  
 [http://typographica.org/001084.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072242/http:/typographica.org/001084.php "http://typographica.org/001084.php")

There’s a (custom) font similar to this one: Gill Sans “Volk und Wissen”.  
“Volk und Wissen” is a German publishing company, specialised in educational / school books (as far as I know...).  
Sorry, couldn't find a sample of this font right now though I remember seeing one in “Erste Hilfe in Typografie” by Hans Peter Willberg and Friedrich Forssmann.  
I doubt that this font is available for the public. But i might be wrong.

I think the lc a is slightly different, so this is most likely an altered version of the original Gill Sans.

@SuperUltraFabulous: [http://www.fonts.com/aboutfonts/articles/fyti/typography+for+children.htm](http://web.archive.org/web/20141030072242/http:/www.fonts.com/aboutfonts/articles/fyti/typography+for+children.htm "http://www.fonts.com/aboutfonts/articles/fyti/typography+for+children.htm")

(e.g. AG Schulbuch / Schoolbook wd be another “infant font”)

Cheers,  
Günni G.

"Where did you find a light version of Gill Sans Schoolbook, Arun?"

Not a light version Sharon, just the regular. On Fontshop.

-  
Arun  
-
